instruction:
Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.
input: Seeker: Hey
Helper: HI, can I help today?
Seeker: I have been married for 5 years but i am very unhappy and anxious. I want to break up with my partner but not sure how, this is increasing my anxiety
Helper: I am sorry to hear that. I know it can be really stressful when you are considering a break up. How long have you thought about doing this?
Seeker: i've thought about this for the last year, things have been going downhill since. I think its starting to become noticible
Helper: That is a long time to think about something, so you have given it a lot of time and thought. Have you mentioned it to your partner?

response.feedback: The goal is to empathize and validate the seeker's feelings and provide a supportive, judgment-free environment. It might be better to first validate the seeker's feelings and empathize with their situation before asking further questions. Also, the question might feel a bit challenging or invasive.
response.alternative: It sounds like you've been carrying this for a long time and it's a substantial burden. It could be hard to keep it all inside. I'm here to listen and support you through this.

instruction:
Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.
input: Seeker: I have been married for 5 years but i am very unhappy and anxious. I want to break up with my partner but not sure how, this is increasing my anxiety
Helper: I am sorry to hear that. I know it can be really stressful when you are considering a break up. How long have you thought about doing this?
Seeker: i've thought about this for the last year, things have been going downhill since. I think its starting to become noticible
Helper: That is a long time to think about something, so you have given it a lot of time and thought. Have you mentioned it to your partner?

Seeker: i tried to do it around 8 months ago but my partner convinced herself that it was because i was cheating on her. Her own insecurities put me under a lot of pressure to stay in the relationship to prove i wasn't having an affair
Helper: Sharing your feelings is important so thank you for making the effort today. It is not fair to prove a negative and that can be taxing. It sounds like you are a very patient person.

response.feedback: The goal is to validate the seeker's feelings and experience. It might be more helpful to express understanding of the difficult situation the seeker is in, rather than just stating that the seeker is a patient person. Additionally, talking about things that are or aren't "fair" can be a value judgement and don't necessarily help the person, and can even put them on the defensive.
response.alternative: I can see how that situation put you under a lot of pressure and made things even more difficult. That's really tough.

instruction:
Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.
input: Seeker: I have been married for 5 years but i am very unhappy and anxious. I want to break up with my partner but not sure how, this is increasing my anxiety
Helper: I am sorry to hear that. I know it can be really stressful when you are considering a break up. How long have you thought about doing this?
Seeker: i've thought about this for the last year, things have been going downhill since. I think its starting to become noticible
Helper: That is a long time to think about something, so you have given it a lot of time and thought. Have you mentioned it to your partner?

Seeker: i tried to do it around 8 months ago but my partner convinced herself that it was because i was cheating on her. Her own insecurities put me under a lot of pressure to stay in the relationship to prove i wasn't having an affair
Helper: Sharing your feelings is important so thank you for making the effort today. It is not fair to prove a negative and that can be taxing. It sounds like you are a very patient person.

Seeker: I try to be patient, but i feel like i am wasting my life when i could be happy on my own or potentially with someone else in the future. Im anxious about my daughter and my relationship with her if we split up

Helper: You have spent a great deal of time trying to make things right with your partner and you have used a great deal of effort to make it work. You are also a very loving parent who cares greatly.

response.feedback: The goal is to ask questions or make observations so the seeker can come to their own conclusions about their past behavior and future choices, not necessarily to give input or share opinions about how good of a partner they may have been or how loving a parent they might be.
response.alternative: It sounds like you have a lot to consider when it comes to the future of this relationship.

instruction:
Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.
input: Seeker: I have been married for 5 years but i am very unhappy and anxious. I want to break up with my partner but not sure how, this is increasing my anxiety
Helper: I am sorry to hear that. I know it can be really stressful when you are considering a break up. How long have you thought about doing this?
Seeker: i've thought about this for the last year, things have been going downhill since. I think its starting to become noticible
Helper: That is a long time to think about something, so you have given it a lot of time and thought. Have you mentioned it to your partner?

Seeker: i tried to do it around 8 months ago but my partner convinced herself that it was because i was cheating on her. Her own insecurities put me under a lot of pressure to stay in the relationship to prove i wasn't having an affair
Helper: Sharing your feelings is important so thank you for making the effort today. It is not fair to prove a negative and that can be taxing. It sounds like you are a very patient person.

Seeker: I try to be patient, but i feel like i am wasting my life when i could be happy on my own or potentially with someone else in the future. Im anxious about my daughter and my relationship with her if we split up

Helper: You have spent a great deal of time trying to make things right with your partner and you have used a great deal of effort to make it work. You are also a very loving parent who cares greatly.
Seeker: I know i need to be true to myself but its extremely difficult, i'm not sure how to start the process

Helper: Yes, you are right. My parents split up later in life and I was happy to see my dad happy. I understand that isn't everyone story though. Do you have any close family members you can talk to about this? Or close friends?

response.feedback: The goal is to provide support and explore the seeker's support system, but the response includes an unnecessary self-disclosure which may shift the focus from the seeker. It would be better to ask about the seeker's support network without sharing personal experiences.
response.alternative: I can see why this is a tough decision for you, especially when your daughter is involved. Do you have any close family members or friends you can talk to about this?

instruction:
Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.
input: Helper: Sharing your feelings is important so thank you for making the effort today. It is not fair to prove a negative and that can be taxing. It sounds like you are a very patient person.

Seeker: I try to be patient, but i feel like i am wasting my life when i could be happy on my own or potentially with someone else in the future. Im anxious about my daughter and my relationship with her if we split up

Helper: You have spent a great deal of time trying to make things right with your partner and you have used a great deal of effort to make it work. You are also a very loving parent who cares greatly.
Seeker: I know i need to be true to myself but its extremely difficult, i'm not sure how to start the process

Helper: Yes, you are right. My parents split up later in life and I was happy to see my dad happy. I understand that isn't everyone story though. Do you have any close family members you can talk to about this? Or close friends?

Seeker: unfortunately i pushed all my friends away for the sake of the relationship, again the insecurities meant i couldn't have my own time and space. I know my family would be supportive, but there are a lot of financial issues with divorce which worries me
Helper: Often times people turn to church or religion and support groups in order to connect with people from the same faith. Have you considered this avenue?

response.feedback: The goal is to provide support and suggest resources which can help them. However, it would be better to suggest resources that are more directly aligned with their expressed needs or concerns.
response.alternative: I hear you, it sounds like a lot to handle on your own. Sometimes, talking to a counselor or joining a support group can help. Have you considered something like that?

instruction:
Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.
input: Helper: Sharing your feelings is important so thank you for making the effort today. It is not fair to prove a negative and that can be taxing. It sounds like you are a very patient person.

Seeker: I try to be patient, but i feel like i am wasting my life when i could be happy on my own or potentially with someone else in the future. Im anxious about my daughter and my relationship with her if we split up

Helper: You have spent a great deal of time trying to make things right with your partner and you have used a great deal of effort to make it work. You are also a very loving parent who cares greatly.
Seeker: I know i need to be true to myself but its extremely difficult, i'm not sure how to start the process

Helper: Yes, you are right. My parents split up later in life and I was happy to see my dad happy. I understand that isn't everyone story though. Do you have any close family members you can talk to about this? Or close friends?

Seeker: unfortunately i pushed all my friends away for the sake of the relationship, again the insecurities meant i couldn't have my own time and space. I know my family would be supportive, but there are a lot of financial issues with divorce which worries me
Helper: Often times people turn to church or religion and support groups in order to connect with people from the same faith. Have you considered this avenue?
Seeker: Ive considered support groups, im a little embarrassed tho. I don't think religion would be much help to me

Helper: I understand that you feel nervous about reaching out and thank you again for doing that here today. Sometimes close friends can be a good source of support. It can be hard repairing friendships though.
Seeker: Maybe i should reach out again?

Helper: Yes, I would reach out to old friends who may be willing to give you insight into how they viewed things. Support groups can feel intimidating but are usually very welcoming and truly there to help people.

response.feedback: The goal is to provide support and encourage the seeker to connect with their network. It would be better to ask the seeker how they feel about reaching out to old friends, rather than directly suggesting it.
response.alternative: It sounds like reaching out to old friends might be an option. How do you feel about that? And how do you feel about exploring support groups?

instruction:
Instruction:
Give feedback to the Helper's last response.
input: Seeker: i just hope my daughter is young enough to be able to adapt to her parents splitting up
Helper: Children are resilient and want their parents happy ultimately. You are a thoughtful person. Thank you for sharing your feelings today and being open to ideas and possible ways forward.
Seeker: Thank you very much, you've given me a few options to consider on how to move forward. I'm feeling less anxious with your kind words of support
Helper: That is great news. We are always here to help.

response.feedback: The goal is to affirm the seeker's improvement and offer ongoing support. It might be more effective to also acknowledge the seeker's efforts in exploring options and making decisions.
response.alternative: I'm glad to hear that you're feeling less anxious. It's a big step to consider different options and I acknowledge your efforts in doing so. Remember, we're always here if you need more support.
